intro: Encephalartos successibus, commonly known as the Knysna cycad, is a rare and ancient cycad species native to South Africa. It is characterized by its stout, unbranched trunk and a crown of large, feather-like leaves that can reach up to 2 meters in length. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are typically pollinated by insects. Encephalartos successibus is adapted to coastal and mountainous habitats, thriving in well-drained soils and mild climates. Due to its limited distribution and habitat threats, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
